title: don't reference container/vector in Effective Go
body:
Effective Go says, in its Naming section:

"Another convention is that the package name is the base name of its source
directory; the package in src/pkg/container/vector is imported as
"container/vector" but has name vector, not container_vector and not
containerVector."

Can we find an example there that's not container/vector, which is kinda a useless /
deprecated package?

I'd hate to be encouraging people to use that in new code.
